intro: Psychotria aubletiana f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptic leaves that are covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically borne in terminal inflorescences. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and potential ethnobotanical significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
